question:
Which of the following statements is / are correct with regard to the “Indo-Pacific freedom corridor”?
  1. It is an Indian-ASEAN joint venture
  2. Its core objective is to develop a multi-modal transport network between India and several ASEAN countries
  3. Connectivity and Infrastructure have got key emphasis in Indo-Pacific freedom corridor
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
explanation:
The “Indo-Pacific Freedom Corridor” project is between India and Japan and focuses on creating infrastructure and connectivity that can somehow counterbalance the OBOR. It was proposed during the annual summit between India and Japan at Tokyo, in November 2016. Salient features of the project
  • Under the Asia-Africa connectivity project, India and Japan will support massive infrastructure projects and capacity building programmes in East Africa
  • Both countries will help in developing the strategically-located Trincomalee port in eastern Sri Lanka
  • Japan will join India in the development and expansion of Iran\'s Chabahar port
  • Japan will also help to develop Dawei port along the Thai-Myanmar border
Background India and Japan are already collaborating in infrastructure development in northeast India and the Andaman and Nicobar Islands. Both India and Japan have also proposed to develop the “Mekong-India Economic Corridor (MIEC)” connecting the Kenya-Tanzania-Mozambique (KTM) growth zone through Jawaharlal Nehru and Kochi ports, which will open up new vistas of Africa-Asia connectivity and unlock Africa\'s economic potential. Further, the Asia-Africa connectivity project aims at developing quality infrastructure (Partnership for Quality Infrastructure) in India, which is the central theme of Japan\'s collaboration with India. To accelerate the process India and Japan will be holding separate sessions with stakeholders from Africa on the sidelines of the Africa Development Bank meeting. Japan\'s state minister of finance will lead the country\'s delegation at the meet.
